title: Coronation Street spoilers: Out of control Max attacks Harry?
text:
Shona Ramsey (Julia Goulding) has been struggling with the out of control behaviour of Max Turner (Harry McDermott) in Coronation Street – and things are about to come to a head. Since David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) went to prison after taking the fall for the theft of Audrey Roberts’ (Sue Nicholls), Max has been mish=behaving and also stopped taking his ADHD medication.

Gradually, things have got worse and Shona has been finding herself out of her depth. So when young Harry is attacked, Shona instantly blames Max – but this ends up being a huge mistake that could be the catalyst for Shona and David losing custody of Max.

Faye Windass (Ellie Leach) is struggling to look after Lily and Harry and Max arrives home in a disruptive and angry mood. As Shona and Sarah (Tina O’Brien) return home to find Max and Lily arguing over the TV, they despair.

Suddenly, there is a crash and Harry is injured and knocked out cold. As Sarah heads off in an ambulance with Harry, Shona rounds on Max and accuses him of hurting Harry – to which he claims that it was Lily who pushed him.

After a row, Max storms out and later, the mother of Max’s late dad Callum arrives. Marion explains to Shona that Max has been visiting her – and then accuses her of being an unfit mother to Max because of the rows and the fact that she has been drinking.

Marion goes on to visit Adam Barlow (Sam Robertson) in order to take the first steps towards getting custody of Max and Shona is later crushed with guilt when Lily admits to her that she did oush Harry.

Later, things get even worse for Shona when she receives a text from Marion warning her that her solicitor will be in touch. Shona is then forced to relay the information back to David, who is deeply concerned to hear of Marion’s plans and as he fears losing Max, Shona despairs at being out of control of the situation.

Will Marion take Max away from the family – and will David blame Shona?

One to watch: Wednesday 16th October at 7:30pm on ITV.
